intro: Sphaeranthus mollis, commonly known as the smooth globeflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small globes. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, showy flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces seeds in small, rounded capsules. Sphaeranthus mollis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
